channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Electric mobility has 'won the race' but Volkswagen hits brakes on EV strategy
item.description: The automaker is selling so many combustion engine cars that it’s on track to overshoot its emissions allowance for next year.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz workers in Alabama vote against UAW union membership
item.description: The results are a blow to the UAW's organizing efforts a month after the Detroit union won an organizing drive of Volkswagen plant workers in Tennessee.

item.title: Trump’s immigration plan could add trillions of dollars to national debt
Debt-hungry Americans focking to Europe as interest rate cuts fuel $33bn 'Reverse Yankee'
item.description: Issuance of European debt could be on track to break records as the Eurozone gets the jump against the Fed in cutting rates.

item.title: Nvidia’s earnings will be in focus next week as stocks try to sustain record levels
item.description: The AI chipmaker could reinvigorate a trade that has the power to propel stocks higher at a time when market leadership has broadened.

item.title: Roaring Kitty roller coaster: GameStop and AMC meme mania is an ‘outlier event’
Wealthy travelers seeking sun, sand, and luxury are flocking to the Caribbean paradise next to Haiti, where armed gangs dominate
item.description: Even Fast & Furious star Vin Diesel wants to build a movie studio there.

item.title: OpenAI dissolves team focused on long-term AI risks, less than one year after announcing it
item.description: OpenAI has dissolved its Superalignment team amid the high-profile departures of both team leaders, Ilya Sutskever and Jan Leike.

item.title: Why Cathie Wood’s ARK Innovation ETF is struggling despite a stock-market rally
This is the best time of day to exercise for people living with obesity, new study shows
item.description: One hormone in particular may explain the health benefits of physical activity at this time.

item.title: 'Dow theory' indicates the march to 40,000 could be short-lived
item.description: Dow theory examines the relationship between the industrial and transportation benchmarks named after Charles Dow.

item.title: Alabama Mercedes plant workers vote against union, slowing UAW effort in South
World's largest asset manager wants Fed to reverse course: Slash rates to tame inflation
item.description: Rick Rieder, BlackRock’s chief investment officer of global fixed income, oversees about $2.4 trillion in investments.

item.title: Campus protests have called for schools to divest from Israel. Here's how that would actually work
item.description: Protesters on campuses nationwide have called on universities to divest from Israel due to the war in Gaza. Here's how divestment would actually work.

item.title: Dow closes above 40K for first time ever, S&P 500 books 4th straight weekly gain
